str2: And, even, also, namely.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To go forward, go on, advance; I go before, precede. From pro and erchomai; to go onward, precede.
Neuter of a compound of en and a derivative of optanomai; in the face of.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Wind, breath, spirit.
And, even, also, namely.
From dunamai; force; specially, miraculous power.
Elijah, the prophet. Of Hebrew origin; Helias, an Israelite.
From epi and strepho; to revert.
Prolonged from a primary kar; the heart, i.e. the thoughts or feelings; also the middle.
Father, (Heavenly) Father, ancestor, elder, senior. Apparently a primary word; a 'father'.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
A child, descendent, inhabitant. From the base of timoria; a child.
And, even, also, namely.
Unbelieving, disobedient, who will not be persuaded. Unpersuadable, i.e. Contumacious.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
From phroneo; mental action or activity, i.e. Intellectual or moral insight.
From dike; equitable; by implication, innocent, holy.
To make ready, prepare. From hetoimos; to prepare.
Apparently a primary word; a people.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: From kata and a derivative of skeuos; to prepare thoroughly; by implication, to construct, create.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
